node.title: Jamie Yuccas on challenges of covering Olympics inside Beijing "bubble"
node.description: On "The Takeout" podcast this week, CBS News correspondent Jamie Yuccas talks about the unusual challenges of covering the winter Olympics in Beijing this month.

node.title: CIA has secret program that collects data on Americans, 2 senators say
node.description: Ron Wyden of Oregon and Martin Heinrich of New Mexico, both Democrats, are pressing for more information on the practice. The CIA's focus is supposed to be abroad.

node.title: Van der Poel breaks the world record in the men’s 10,000-meter speedskating.
node.description: His time was almost 14 seconds, about half a lap, faster than any other skater in the race.

node.title: Some homeowners have been caught out by recent tax measures - expert
node.description: Chartered Accountants ANZ financial services leader says there has been no education about how tax changes affect homeowners who are not investors.

node.title: Covid-19: Record 446 new community cases today
node.description: The Ministry of Health says the number of cases will continue to fluctuate from day-to-day, but they expect cases will continue to increase in the coming weeks.

node.title: An Olympian’s Routine: Skiing, Shooting, Soldiering
node.description: The Army National Guard finances the training of elite American biathletes if they agree to join full time.

node.title: Covid-19: $38.7m in overdue MIQ bills still sought
node.description: With the amount owed in unpaid MIQ bills climbing to $38.7 million, one academic says it could be time to start charging interest.

node.title: Prince Charles tests positive for Covid-19 two days after meeting with Queen
node.description: Prince Charles tested positive on Thursday morning - the second time he has contracted the virus.

node.title: A speedskating rivalry between the Netherlands and Sweden heats up in Beijing.
node.description: Nils van der Poel of Sweden has won every distance race he entered this year.

node.title: Covid-19: 10 million vaccines given in New Zealand
node.description: The government is celebrating a milestone of 10 million Covid-19 vaccines administered, as protesters against vaccine mandates continue to stake out the Parliament lawn.

node.title: Omicron outbreak may empty Parliament's debating chamber
node.description: There could soon be as few as two MPs in Parliament's debating chamber as the Omicron outbreak grows.

node.title: West warns of 'dangerous moment' as Russia holds drills in Belarus
node.description: Britain says the West could face the "most dangerous moment" in its standoff with Moscow in the next few days.

node.title: In-Betweens: 2 Middle Grade Novels About the Costs and Benefits of Being 11
node.description: The National Book Award finalists Leslie Connor and Sara Zarr explore that frustrating time between childhood and adolescence.

node.title: What Elon Musk Did and Didn’t Reveal About SpaceX’s Starship Rocket
node.description: The founder of the private space company rehashed his broad vision of colonizing Mars, but he provided few clear details about when Starship would get to orbit.

node.title: Elon Musk says first orbital Starship flight could happen in March
node.description: SpaceX's Starship is the most powerful rocket ever built.

node.title: Govt announces $15.7m to help Māori Covid-19 response
node.description: Proposals to build resilience and support vaccination uptake are receiving more funding from the Māori Communities Covid-19 Fund.

node.title: Deal agreed between council, protesters to end takeover of Picton park
node.description: A peaceful agreement has been reached to end protesters' occupation of a park in Picton by the middle of next week.

node.title: The Chinese men’s hockey team has an international cast.
node.description: Making its debut in the Winter Olympics, the team had to reach far and wide to cobble together a competitive roster.

node.title: Sir Peter Jackson tops Forbes' highest paid entertainer list
node.description: The Kiwi director heads the list of the world's highest paid entertainers after the sale of part of his digital effects company, according to Forbes.

node.title: 17-year-old in custody in connection with stabbing at Buffalo high school
node.description: A student was stabbed and a security guard was shot outside of McKinley High School on Wednesday.

node.title: Sting sells his entire recording catalogue to Universal Music
node.description: The Rock and Roll Hall of Fame member joins a chorus of stars who are cashing in with investors who see value in licensing their songs.

node.title: Bob Saget died from accidental head trauma, medical examiner says
node.description: The "Full House" star died last month at the age of 65.

node.title: Shaun White finishes 4th in halfpipe at his final Olympics
node.description: White finished in fourth place as he fell on the final run of a career that's seen the American star win three Olympic titles.

node.title: Marylands School abuses like 'open slather' at 'butchers shop'
node.description: A former student of Marylands School in Christchurch has described it as a meat market with a rampant sexual culture.

node.title: California judge restores federal protection for gray wolves in 44 states
node.description: A California judge has ruled that the gray wolf should be returned to the Endangered Species list after hunters have decimated the species in recent years.

node.title: New regulations won't stop young people taking up vaping - expert
node.description: New regulations on vape products come into force from today but a public health expert says the change won't do anything to stop the rise in young people vaping. Audio

node.title: Biden plans to begin interviewing Supreme Court finalists next week
node.description: The president met Thursday at the White House with Democratic members of the Senate Judiciary Committee, but did not review specific women under consideration for the post.

node.title: Figure skating sensation Kamila Valieva attends practice at Olympic Ice venue
node.description: Figure skating sensation Kamila Valieva attends practice at Olympic Ice venue in Beijing despite positive test

node.title: More rain expected for most of NZ as cyclone Dovi approaches
node.description: More rain is forecast for much of the country going into the weekend, including the already drenched West Coast's Buller district which is in a state of emergency. Audio

node.title: Distribution of aid in Tonga starting to pick up
node.description: The unpacking of aid in Tonga has been made with easier with forklifts to help distribute much needed supplies to families.
